questions: What is the main purpose of an operating system (OS)?
answers: To manage hardware and software so programs can run and the user can control the computer.

questions: What is the function of the kernel?
answers: It is the core part of the OS that controls memory, processes, and hardware communication.

questions: What does it mean to “boot” a computer?
answers: To start the system and load the operating system into memory.

questions: What is Safe Mode mainly used for?
answers: To start the OS with minimal drivers/services to help troubleshoot problems.

questions: What is the purpose of user accounts on an OS?
answers: To separate users and control what each person can access or change.

questions: What is the function of an administrator account?
answers: It can install software, change system settings, and manage other accounts.

questions: What is the purpose of device drivers?
answers: They let the OS communicate correctly with hardware like printers, GPUs, and Wi-Fi cards.

questions: What does a file system do?
answers: It organizes and stores files and folders on a drive so the OS can find and use them.

questions: What is the main function of Task Manager (or Activity Monitor)?
answers: To view and manage running apps/processes and system resource usage.

questions: What does “End Task/Force Quit” do?
answers: It stops a frozen program so the computer can respond again.

questions: What is the purpose of system updates?
answers: To fix bugs, improve performance, and patch security vulnerabilities.

questions: What is the function of a restore point (System Restore)?
answers: To roll back system settings/files to an earlier working state.

questions: What is the purpose of disk cleanup/storage management tools?
answers: To remove unnecessary files and free up storage space.

questions: What does “formatting a drive” mainly do?
answers: It prepares the drive with a file system and usually erases existing data.

questions: What is the purpose of the Command Prompt/Terminal?
answers: To run text commands to manage files, settings, and troubleshooting tools.

questions: What does “installing an OS” mean?
answers: Copying OS files to a drive and setting it up so the computer can start and run it.

questions: What is the function of a partition?
answers: It divides a physical drive into separate sections that can store data or different OS installs.

questions: What is the purpose of virtualization features in an OS?
answers: To support running virtual machines or virtual environments more efficiently.

questions: What is the purpose of a firewall built into an OS?
answers: To help block unwanted network connections and protect the system.

questions: What does it mean to set a default application?
answers: Choosing which app opens a file type automatically (like PDFs opening in a specific reader).
